Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: ஆக்கமுங் கேடும் அதனால் வருதலாற் காத்தோம்பல் சொல்லின்கட் சோர்வு.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: Since (both) wealth and evil result from (their) speech, ministers should most carefully guard themselves against faultiness therein.

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A person's mouth is shown speaking. From one side of the mouth, words emerge that transform into golden, constructive things like bountiful crops and strong buildings (Prosperity - 'ஆக்கம்').
Layered_Composition.Midground: From the other side of the same mouth, other words emerge that transform into destructive things like fire and thorny weeds (Ruin - 'கேடு').
Layered_Composition.Background: A wise hand is shown carefully guarding the mouth ('காத்தோம்பல்'), filtering the words to ensure that only the constructive ones emerge and preventing any slip-ups ('சோர்வு') that would release the destructive ones.

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: Both prosperity and ruin can come from speech; therefore, one must vigilantly guard against any error or slip of the tongue.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The words literally transforming into either constructive or destructive elements is the central metaphor. The guarding hand represents the act of vigilance.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: The prosperous words are golden and brightly lit. The ruinous words are fiery red and dark. The scene has a strong light/dark duality.

Technical_Cues.Camera: An extreme close-up on the mouth, capturing the dual nature of the words as they emerge.
Technical_Cues.Resolution: 8K, with complex and beautiful transformation effects.
Technical_Cues.Lighting: Split lighting to match the good and bad outcomes.

Cultural_Anchors: Guarding against slips of the tongue ('சொல்லின்கட் சோர்வு காத்தோம்பல்')

Negative_Prompt: only good words, only bad words, text in the words, cartoonish.

Hyperparameters.seed: Explore variations for the word transformation effects.
